comments.text: I posted up a little farther down the ramp but close enough. It's a good ramp. If you're planning to get caught in Lake Louise, bring provisions though. Stores here will rip you off.

Got picked up twice in the same day at this spot in winter around 2pm and 7pm on friday. Really good, wide enough to pull over and cars are still driving slowly ! Dropped off in Banff, but could have been to Calgary with the same driver !
Stand right on the corner of where the irving pavement lot meets the road and have a big sign saying where you want to go since people will be either going west or east. June 2025.

Hichthiked towards St Johns here in late September. If you stand next to the road make sure to have a sign with you that says where you are going as the highway splits into two. It's a great spot though, slow and a lot of traffic.

Southwards and northwards. Stop at the Big Stop and ask the people for being picked up.
It should work pretty well.
great spot. Slow traffic, lots of room to stop. Got picked up very quick.
Easy access, good visibility, slow traffic, lots of room to pull off. Most traffic will be going to Whistler or Pemberton area.
2 hikers in a big Jeep took us exactly where we wanted to go (Garibaldi Lake Trail, Rubble Creek Trailhead), we were very lucky!
Traffic is slow through town, people can pull into side streets to pick you up
Amazing spot to hitchhike, there's also a truck stop so you can try and ask around, didn't take long to get a ride with a guy all the way to Edmonton even though it was very late afternoon :)

I got three ride offers in 30min, but they were all short. I took the last one, and got skunked two ramps down. Try to only accept rides that are going to Hope or beyond. 

With the truckstop, this is a good ramp to post up on.

I posted up on the ramp, at the end of the Jersey barrier. I didn't have to wait very long. There is a big truck stop near by for provisions, and the SFX bus stops just up the road, so this is a good spot for heading east out of the lower mainland.
Very good spot to go to Québec city

Really nice spot!
The best thing : you have a free place to camp in case you dont find a lift!

Really nice spot !! 
2 gas station, busy
went to Les promenades Gatineau
easy to go to gatineau
Good spot, going south. July 2025.
Walking out to the highway with my thumb out, good room for cars to pull over. Got a ride out to the highway. July 2025.
Good spot. Gas station right across the road, got a ride to Red bay from here. July 2025.
Great spot for hitching out of Stephenville. Got a ride all the way to Deer Lake in under five seconds. June 2025.

Going North, decent spot you can hitch the on ramp and the highway at the same time depending on the traffic. lots of stores nearby and what not. If you can try to get a ride before or on the ferry because they let the foot passengers off last so you can't really catch any of the traffic off the ferry since they've all left by the time you get off the boat. June 2025.
Good spot, lots of room for cars to pull over and also its a straight stretch so they can see you from far away. July 2025. Close to a town to.
Good Spot lots of room for cars to pull over got picked up quickly, heading to do the Gros Morne hike (you must do the hike if your in the area and fit, it has great scenery). July 2025.
Started a conversation with an older chap, ended up paying a taxi ride back to Rocky Harbour for me. July 2025.
Going west. Good traffic nothing crazy, long straight stretch, decent shoulder. If your going to be in this area you should go check out the Insectarium (cost's money). July 2025.
Great spot. Got a gas station and tims close by also its a long straight stretch. July 2025

Great spot. You got a gas station and tims in view so people stopping there can get a good look at you and have more time to decide whether to pick you up also good if need some food or water. Got a ride from here early in the morning all the way to St, John's. July 2025.

great spot with loads of space to stop direction east. Slow traffic coming from roundabout. Little sign gives you some shade too. Nice view. Treat yourself to a milkshake across the street. 10/10 would hitch again here.

pretty great spot, people turning are going slow and see you very well. Also, space to stop. We were standing in the scorching heat for only 5min, thank god. Just is a small hike from Lillooet, might be worth it. This place is hot in summer, bring enough water and sunscreen!

Busy yet remote gas station, trucks can stop here too. Got picked up after 20min after asking around. As of 09/25, Flix Buses stop here of the way to Medicine Hat and Edmonton, if you run out of luck.
Wide shoulders. A lot of traffic.
Heading west out of Pemberton, this spot is pretty solid.

This is a pretty good spot. There isn't a ton of room for vehicles to pull off safely, but there is enough. If you're heading west from Princeton this is where you want to post up. The folks at the husky across the road are pretty friendly.
Fairly quick after the first driver drop me off m, the second driver just approached shortly after
A random traffic light in the suburban sprawl, with a sign saying Canmore /shrug/

First hitchhike in Quebec for me !

After the last big intersection of Talbot Boulevard in Chicoutimi, direction Quebec / Mtl.
Practical for the possibility of sheltering from the rain at the SAQ Sélection.

I was trying to get to Kelowna, so I posted up before the Y. There's a huge shoulder, and traffic is moving pretty slow.

We took Hwy 33, We had a great conversation.
There's a bus that come's out here from Vernon. I posted up just past this little truck stop. Traffic is still moving pretty slow, I've had good luck here over the years.
Right after the light is the best spot heading south. The traffic is moving slow and there is a huge amount of room for folks to pull off.
If you're going down 3A towards Keremeos, Then this'll be your best bet. Don't try to walk it. There are way too many blind corners, and hardly any good pullouts along this highway.

When ever I'm going west from Keremeos, I usually post up across from the Canco. The last time I was there I didn't even make it out that far before someone stopped and picked me up. They gave me a ride all the way out to Tsawwassen.
Ramp on to trading post. Cars not going to fast. Not too much traffic but got a ride in 30 mins. After dropping me off he invited me to his house in Montreal and said he'd lend me one of his cars!

Awesome spot for going north out of Hope. Decent visibility, room to pull over and only traffic here is headed that direction. Not a long walk from town/campsites if you can't get a ride. Had 2 people stop in 20 mins, 2nd one took me all the way to North Bend.
Awesome spot for going east. Great visibility. Right after a traffic light, lots of room to pull over. Lots of through-traffic. Highly recommend.
You can easily go down the city from this parking lot exit.
You can easily go to Squamish or Whistler from here. We waited a bit because a lot of cars were full but all hikers here are very friendly.
Really great gas station with friendly staff. A good place to get a ride to the lake

There is not even a sign prohibiting to go on the on-ramp here! So it is technically legal contrary to all other on-ramps in the area!

Flat surface with enough land for cars to pull off. A nearby field close-by to nap, hide of stash things + close to a Walmart. This is straight a few minutes from the Vaughan station, the northmost station to leave the city. Easiest so far!
I caught a lift to St. Catharines from here.
J'ai marché jusqu'à la station Shell, et là France et son époux ont accepté de m'emmener jusqu'en Ontario.

Fait du pouce du village de St Tim jusqu'à la rive nord du St Laurent, à Saint Zotiquie, direction l'Ontario. Got there in a coupe of rides 

Incroyable, géniales expériences.
Got a ride to the bretelle d'autoroute of Chateauguay after failing to visit ces messieurs et dames de la réserve Mohawk -.-
Didn’t wait long and got the coolest ride ever. All the way to the coast!
Not the best wait time but the best driver ever picked me up here. Took me way further than he was intending just to get me further down the road.
First car I stuck my thumb out for pulled over and took me out of the way of where they were going to take me to my uncles in Stanley. Smoothest hitching experience ever.
Good spot for going West. Waited just 15 min. Cars can spot you early and slow down because of the traffic lights
Great spot to go to the east, especially for truck. Go there in the morning if you want to go far away.

There is a park and ride, just past the end of the on ramp. If you're hitching in the winter don't accept a ride to the ski hill unless you're going up there. In the past, I did and I spent the night in the middle of nowhere.
We were waiting at the red light to ask driver.
Just stay on the ferry and ask people, the second car I asked picked me up and got me to Vernon
Lots of people traveling long distances
Cyprus Lake road is forbidden to pedestrians, but park rangers encouraged me to hitchike and the third car picked me up (first two wanted to but we're full of camping gear)
2 cars stopped in 3 minutes, people here are super nice
I was standing at the end of the ramp. Basically just off the highway. I got really lucky. It was after 6pm on a Friday. The guy could've taken me all the way to Kamloops.
Great place to get west out of Banff. Walkable from the downtown. Don't go to the gas stations in Banff, as they are too far from the highway and only local people use them.

Amazing place to hitch, unfortunately I got a ride with a creepy American guy who lied about where he was going so after a few miles, I got off the car and decided to hitch back to this place, then got a ride all the way to Golden
STAY ON THE RAMPE IN WINTER, the shoulder is really small all the way no one (or almost) will stop on the HW
très bon spot pour aller vers le lac Saint-Jean Je me suis mis devant le passage piéton où il y avait de la place pour qu'une voiture s'arrête

A-70 West towards JonquiÃ¨re, Lac-Saint-Jean. As much traffic as the area can provide, right after a stoplight. Lots of room for cars to park. You might hit local traffic, make sure you know where you go. If you want to go to the Lac-Saint-Jean area, avoid anybody whom drives less further than Saint-Bruno.

Waited at the off road before Pizza Hut with an Irish flag tied to my camping gear. After no more than 15 minutes a man pulled up in his company truck and offered to bring me some of the way. After chatting for a bit he told me he’d go about 10 minutes out of the way on his journey to bring me all the way to the entrance to tea lake campground. Lovely chap

Waited on the slip road by pizza hut. After 30 mins got a ride from a lovely dude who then offered to give weed and booze supply runs for summer camp. Let me drink beer in passenger seat and offered his dab pen from the trunk!

Got exceptionally lucky here.
Lady saw me at the tims with my bags, thought I might be a hitchhiker and when leaving stopped for me. Had barely pulled out my sign.
There is a truck stop here and good visibility. I had the shortest wait of my life here, but I got lucky.
good spot for going east, waited about 20 minutes for a long ride
Not so much traffic, there's some place to pull-over. Stood for around 40 minutes just before the sign "no pedestrians" and got a nice ride for 2 hours east.

If you are coming from Quebec, take the Ferry to Levis and walk or hitch a ride to this place where you can easily catch people making longer distances. It's very hard to leave Quebec city by the bridges to the 20 otherwise.
good spot to hitch towards the east. Got a ride to Thunder Bay pretty quick early in the morning.
If you get dropped off in and around Kenora and plan on going further east this will probably be your best shot. There is a nice set of lights so people can see you and a shoulder to pull over.
great spot from the campsite. Much space, great view. We were two and got a ride to Banff pretty quick.

If you are staying at the campsite and want to go south towards Banff this is the best stop. Stand right where the shoulder reaches it maximum width so that cars coming from Jasper and the campground have a good visual on you and enough room to stop behind. I hitchhiked together with another guy and it took about an hour until someone stopped. If you are going by yourself it'll be even easier to get a ride.
Good traffic. Lots of room for cars to safely stop. Got a ride to Banff.
This is your best bet for hitching west from Calgary.
Got a direct ride to Banff on friday around 5pm, shoulder is not really wide but people could pick you up !

Waited between Mcdonalds and the gas station for 5min, cars are able to stop before going into the road. Great spot to be seen! I recommend. We headed Quebec City in 2hours from there, the driver took us where we needed in the city.

We were heading to Quebec city from montreal, got here it started to get dark and we've been very lucky after few minutes someone took us straight to Quebec, gave us a tour of the old town and drop us right at the door of our friend

Ultramar station

Towards Montréal or Trois-rivières/Québec.

Lot of drivers, ask'em !

We stand a few steps before the pedestrians and bicycle sign, so that cars have enough time to stop after us, before going to the high road. We stand for 40min with a sign for Quebec and then someone took us to Berthierville where we waited 5minutes before having a lift to Quebec City.
I hitchhiked here just today and got ride within couple minutes. Very good spot, I was standing more down the road, by the no pedestrian and bicycles sign.

Excellent moyen de sortir de MontrÃ©al vers l'est.  Prendre l'autobus pour Repentigny (dÃ©part mÃ©tro Radisson) et dÃ©barquer a la gare d'Ã©change.  Une lÃ©gÃ¨re marche sur la rue de la Fayette et vous Ãªtes sur une entrÃ©e d'autoroute trÃ¨s passante ou il y a mÃªme une lumiere de circulation.  80% des gens passant a cette endroit empruntent l'autoroute.
I got a ride pretty quickly. Buddy was crazy, but he got me farther down the road.
Seems ideal, but I waited all evening with no ride, spent the night in the forest, then walked up the road to the Hotsprings turn-off and waited 2 hours till a ride

Good spot if you are heading north. Space to stop, low speed, ...
Close to gasstation.
Yeah, if you're going to Kelowna this is your spot.

Good spot if you are going to Kellowna.
Lot's of space to pull over, right after lights. Close to information centre.

It's a great spot for cars to stop. Was just standing opposite of the police station and even though it took me a few hours, I got a lift all the way to Thunder Bay. There's also a decent spot to pitch a tent behind Tom Hortons
Enough space to pull over, it was pouring rain but even though there were two of us, we managed to get a ride in a few minutes
I guess i was lucky, waited 30 minutes for a direct ride to Sault Ste Marie, a trucker just stopped in the side road.
I think it was the second car that picked me up. Hitchhiking is generally viewed as a form of public transit in the area, and people are pretty friendly.
Hitching in the Kootenays is good. People are pretty relaxed. If you're hitching North to Nelson. The shoulders are wide through town and when you get to the end there is a nice tree to wait under.
The transcanada was closed between lake Louise and Golden, so there was a lot of traffic there. But in general it's a great place, there is a space for trucks to stop and speeds are quite low.
The second car stopped :D 2 minute wait maximum.

Hitching south to Radium Hot Springs and farther.

Good spot, drivers can see you and there's a big parking lot to pull over.

This spot is pretty fast. But the visibility is ok, and there is room to pull off the road.

There is a trail system that runs along the highway, follow it until you find the maintenance access. Dont jump or vandalize the fence. There is a gate, jump it or you can wade through the bramble... and you'll be on the highway. Hitching is fairly common in this area so you shouldn't have to wait too long.
first car that passed
Straight stretch, lots of room for drivers to pull over.  Easily accessible by taking the #257 bus to Horseshoe Bay.  Waited about 20 minutes
great spot for hitching a ride west got picked up by a trucker coming out of the truck stop
Wide shoulder to stop, people are going long distances, I got a ride to Regina almost instantly.
Really good. Easy to get close with $2 bus fare from the centre of Winnipeg. Waited 50 min with an "Alaska" sign and got a ride to the highway 1 and 16 split near Portage la Prairie.
Had a ride for Brandon in 30 minutes with a "Regina" sign
Great location, near a truck-stop. Wides shoulders, but speeds can be high when lights are green.
Good spot, there is lots of traffic and plenty of space to stop. Traffic light slows it down. I got a direct ride to Tofino after about 10 minutes
look out 4/laugh at the "no hitchhiking pickup is illegal" sign
I tried to hitch after the traffic lights to get to Tofino, took a while, probably should have tried from the information center.
Traffic lights with a Information center. Substitute spot if you coming off the ferry and can't get a ride. Good for going north or to Tofino, Port Alberni.
good spot just as other reviews say
Definitely the best place to get out of North Bay, didn't even have to stick my thumb up and got a ride west
We (French couple) only waited 1 minute to get a ride to Sudbury

The best spot for going West out of North Bay.  There's a stop light and plenty of room to pull over.  If you go down the road to the hospital, there's another light but it only turns red when a car is turning in or out of the hospital and there's less room to pull over.  I hitched over a dozen times from this spot.  Unfortunately, North Bay is not a good hitching town and I averaged over an hour wait.

Good spot overall.
Took a while, but it was getting into the evening. Found a long ride all the way into Saskatchewan.
Again 2 of us, we waited quite long, 45 minutes, but I guess it's just random. Good place to pull over, right after traffic lights, so people have loads of time to notice you. Direction east.
Good spot to pull over right after traffic lights. Direction east.

I posted up at the intersection of hwy-6 and 1st ave.

This spot should probably be moved, it's in the middle of the trees.

Get here early in the day to catch folks making a day trip to the Okanagan.

Traffic volume is really low, but the percentage of drivers that are willing to stop is pretty high. I ended up getting a ride all the way to Kelowna.
Very few cars, but they are slow and people are friendly. If you get a ride to the ferry then it's easy to get another one towards Vernon
Spot for going to Victoria, had a long wait tho...
Heavy traffic, very stoppable, good visibility, but speeds are high if cars're not stopped by the traffic light.
Little traffic due to industrial area, but most will be going a fair distance from here
got stuck for the day and night good spot nonetheless better than just outside of thunder bay
Nice lady at the store brought me a coffee because it was raining. Got a ride all the way to Winnipeg.
Truck stop is the saving grace here & makes life pretty easy.
very reliable spot to get a ride going south. generally a 30-90min wait for a ride
Decent spot, late in the evening traffic was scarce but eventually a trucker picked me up and drove me to the Baie-Comeau area. July 2025.

Good spot low traffic, cars can see you from far away also room to pull over for them.  If I had to do it again I would start walking north and just have my thumb out while I walk beats standing on the side of the road for hours like me. Bring lots of water and food. June 2025.

Decent spot, good line of sight for the drivers to see you also room to pull over. Traffic is scarce in the late afternoon, be prepared to be stuck for hours bring lots of water and sun protection. June 2025.
Good Spot. Heading North towards the viking place minimal traffic but the locals always help you out with rides.
Good Spot, heading south towards Rocky Harbour. July 2025.
Not the best spot in the world but it works, got a gas station close by to if need be. July 2025.
Good spot, make sure you wake up early so you can catch people heading to work, I missed that opportunity but still made it out pretty quick all things considered. July 2025.
Good spot, low traffic, heading towards trout river, got picked up by a local. If need be you can just walk into trout river.
Low traffic but good spot.
Good spot, low traffic but got a ride from a local all the way to the green gardens hike.
Decent spot with a good view, traffic was low but the locals around here were great Never went more than a car or two before being picked up. Was heading back to the main highway. July 2025.
Set myself up across from the air plane museum got a ride fairly quickly, cars are going slower through gander so this is a good spot. July 2025.
Good spot, good shoulder, straight stretch, took a while to get a ride here but that was my luck. July 2025.
Straight stretch, decent shoulder. July 2025.
Decent amount of traffic got a 30 minute ride out of town and the stood on the highway thumbing
good spot right here lots of room to pull over next to the comfort inn

The Spot is not bad for hitchhiking towards the south (North Bay), cars are going slow enough and there is a wide shoulder. Got stuck there for a day anyways, but there is an ESSO Gas station opposite where I was lucky to get a ride all the way to Montréal. The street through Matheson going east is used frequently by people coming from Route 11 and going to Quebec / Montréal.

Hitching East, this was an okay spot. Your best shot is probably talking to people making a stop at the coffee shop across the street, that's how I got a ride to Timmins. Be aware that the road going east will be leading thru 2.5 hours of nothing, with often no reception. I was told some hitchhiker disappeared here in 2025.
reasonable spot to go east. Traffic goes quite slow and enough room to pull over. Got a ride to Longlac. Not much traffic tho, on a Saturday.

Got stuck in Medicine Hat for a day. The spot is quite good, lots of room to pull over and cars are going slow. Got a ride to Dunmore the first day, where I got stuck and had to hitch back. Day 2 was the lucky one, after 1h wait a guy took me all the way to Manitoba. Don't give up!
waited about 45, room for cars to pull over on shoulder, cops didnt seem to care, got a ride straight to montreal
waited about an hour, room for cars to stop/pull into the gas station. cops drove by didnt seem to care
okay spot, got dropped here. People are going quite slow and there is a bit of space to pull over. Not much traffic, makes it easier. Were lucky to get a ride to Valemount.

It's a nice slow spot, with good room and visibility, but 99% of the traffic here is going to the Res. (Local traffic). If you're hitching through you might want to take the bus ($2.50) out to the bridge / res turn off, and hitch from there.
What little through traffic that there is, is mostly bikes & RVs.

This is the last town before Lilooet, but from what I could see the traffic volume is extremely low.

I didn't have a lot of time to wait, so I ended up turning around and taking the Tra
Hitching east on hwy-6 this is probably the best spot. There's good visibility, and enough room for vehicles to pull off.
Traffic volume on this highway is pretty low, but the percentage of drivers willing to stop is pretty high. I got picked up pretty late in the day and got a ride all the way to Nakusp.

We came here after the failure of hitchhiking 200m before on highway (see other post).
Few cars passing but they will take you! (we were heading east)

C'est un excellent lieu si vous voulez voyager vers le Saguenay/Lac-St-Jean. Il y a un arrêt, donc ça oblige les chauffeurs à s'immobiliser, et ils vont vous voir. Le seul hic, c'est que le trafic est relativement limité sur cette entrée d'autoroute.

There's a place for vehicles to pull off, and great visibility. There is still a little bit of local traffic, butout here you're past most of it. I got a ride in less than an hour on a slow Saturday morning.

There's a huge pullout over here. Grand Forks can be hit or miss, but this spot is probably your best bet for heading east. unfortunately I only got a ride to Christina lake the last time I went through here.

There is a lot of traffic going back and forth between here and the Teck Metals plant in Trail.
This spot is pretty good, but it does put you on the wrong side of the Jersey barrier. That said there is plenty of room for cars to pull off.
I didn't know what to expect here. It's a pretty fast spot. But, there's room to pull off and people seem to stop.

I got trafic of people coming from the town and the camping street and I was in front of the post office, so at the end the delivery guy from Post office gave me a ride to Sooke. After from Sooke there is public bus to Victoria ;)

Decent spot outside a commercial area. Visibility good, enough room to pull over, and low speed as it's right after a traffic light. Took a long long time because we were 2 women traveling and Vernon is a bit of a pain to hitch out of :-) Ride did not take us far, but was enough to keeo the morale up.

Got a ride super quick. All the highway through-traffic goes through here, with some cars coming from the off-ramp from Gasoline Alley. Excellent visibility, room to pull over.
*On a highway though, so be careful.*

Next-best spot out of Leduc as it has lots of traffic. Side of the highway has decent visibility and room to pull over. Only 2 lanes wide here, so easier for drivers to switch over. Not ideal because it is on a highway!
Sorti mon pouce sur la bretelle d'autoroute de Chateaugay à Salaberry. Picked up in 20 minutes or so. Ended up in St Thimothy , on the way to Salaberry
If you get stuck in Brooks, this is a good spot to get out of there. Truck drivers most likely are going to Medicine Hat
Short walk up the hill, way better spot than down in the city. Big shoulder.
Not a bad spot. Not a huge shoulder but traffic is light and slow so people can stop. People in this area will probably stop for you. Got a ride to castlegar
Got a ride to Freddy from here pretty quick.

Waiting here with a sign "Hwy 17 West" - few cars stopped in front of the Esso (asking at the petrol station didnt work so well). Most offered a ride to Sudburry, which was nice but we wanted to stay on the Highway. After half an hour a young couple travelling to BC picked us up and gave us a ride on Hwy 17 to Espanola where we wanted to go

Best way to go west from Chilliwack. There isn't much space, but traffic is slow enough to stop easily. Problem can be that there is too much traffic and they don't see you early enough, but it shouldn't be too long before the right one comes.
Plenty of space (got a ride from a truck), but traffic is low
Good spot, and it's possible to get trucks that are just getting on the highway from the truck stop since they are still at low speed.

Easy to get into the park: indigenous people from the reserve are pretty nice and took me all the way to the park gate. Note that hitchhiking is illegal in Pukaskwa national park, but you can ask people in the campground to get rides out of there.

Spot is beside the "Pines shore road" sign. You can also ask at the restaurant but I didn't need to
Big pick up with trailer was able to stop there, plenty of space. If in the Soo, it can be good to get a short ride there to find a longer ride afterwards

Better to get a ride while on the ferry but this is a good spot right off it. Trucks can't stop there but there are 2 lanes of traffic + the parking of the restaurant, enough for cars to stop. Gotta get there fast once the ferry arrives, because after that there won't be traffic.

Good spot, lots of traffic, high visibility and frequent traffic light changes. 
Most of the traffic isnt going far, so only got a short stop to Strathmore.
Definitely follow other reviewers advice about the side of the road to stand on.

Tried hitching a ride on the right side of the road in front of the traffic light with a sign saying "east", 1h no luck. Then a friendly driver told me to stand on the left side of the eastward traffic, on the traffic island there, because the two leftmost Lanes go mostly eastward and the right lane goes North and west. Was lucky in 30 more minutes. Great spot to stop in front the traffic light, loads of room there.
I was unable to get a ride east. After 1h, I stand at the red light across the junction instead and got a ride within seconds.
At the red light, I showed a sign to Regina and got a ride within seconds to Strathmore.
There is a strip mall to the north of the intersection, with a laundromat. Standing here you will get a lot of Stoney trail traffic, but its less of a walk. Better for later in the day.
The spot works... but there´s a ton of traffic and it´s not very chill. No traffic lights anymore.
worked well for me because you have the slow traffic merging onto the highway who have time to look at you and read your sign

Get to the last set of traffic lights on the no 1 road (The Trans-Canada road) going west from Calgary, just facing the Canada Olympic Park. Walk another 200 meters to the point where it splits, and stand between the road going straight (road no. 1) and the road going right. You're trying to catch a ride on road no. 1. A little spooky, but took me 15 minutes only with a big sign.
cars are going fast, room to stop though, quick pick up got a ride past edmondston
I got dropped off just there, so had to try my chances. Got a ride quickly, there's safe place to pull over. It's not legal though.

The mood in Osoyoos felt pretty hostile. This place is definitely not what it used to be. I ended up taking the bus to Penticton

They've installed a curb along this section of the road, so there isn't a great place for folks to pull off until the next intersection.

If you're going north from here you might be better off taking the bus. BC Transit runs from here to Penticton a few times a day during week days.
If you want to get out of Osoyoos north is probably your best bet. This road has plenty of places to turn off and the best traffic volume in the area.
Didn't have any trouble here, having a sign helped and I got a ride almost immediately. Express bus gets you there from downtown.
If you're heading south the city bus goes as far as Peachland.
dreadful
High speed traffic, but space on the shoulder. Pretty easy to get to by bus, but there is some walking to do.
took 15 min at about 6 pm in middle of august, got a rid to Moose Jaw where I camped the night
Few people stopped to offer a ride , all short distances , got a ride to outside of oshawa

I was hitchhiking here with my thumb and spent there more than 20 minutes in cold wind. Most of the traffic coming to this intersection is bound for Toronto so I decided to walk to the east intersection with this Highway at east part of Oshawa, got lucky there.

Take the go train to Oshawa and walk onto the highway ramp. Ignore the no pedestrian/bike signs. Ask the driver, if they aren't going too far, if they can drop you of at an onroute. Got a direct ride to Montreal from the next onroute station.

Would be a more suitable spot if it were not closed for construction. Ended up walking toward the highway where I was picked up after about 45 mins. High speed, too many lanes, poor visibility. No other suitable spots or bus routes nearby. Make sure it's open before you go!
Despite a good sign and being looking very clean and smiley ... I waited almost 2 hours by -4°C to get a ride to Nisku where I got a ride to Calgary in a poor hitchhiking spot.. It is all about luck!

Good ramp, lots of space to pull over. Good traffic, but few people stops despite a good sign and being looking very clean and smiling ...
I waited almost 2 hours by -4°C to get a ride to Nexus where I got a ride to Calgary in a poor hitchhiking sport.. It is all about luck!
Standing at traffic light is the best option.
Good spot to go west from Medicine Hat. Right past the coffee stops, and after traffic lights, uphill, with wide shoulders. Took me 15 minutes with a sign.
There is not enough (legal) space for the cars to spot unless they block others right behind them. Bad spot in my opinion!
Cars are scarce. Anywhere along this stretch is good. Go check out the local museum while your here. July 2025.

Anywhere along this stretch is a good spot to wait traffic is low so they can just stop on the road no problem make sure you start early in the morning though, the bugs were bad but I brought a bug net and long clothing so they were manageable make sure you do the same. June 2025.

Just walking with my thumb out, got a ride to L'Anse-au-Clair pretty quickly, was late in the evening so low traffic. Make sure you try to get a ride before or on the ferry, the good part of this ferry was they let me off first but nobody from the ferry picked me up. Bring lots of sun, bug, and wind protection also lots of water and food if you plan on hitching through Labrador. July 2025.

I stood at the bottom of the first hill, going north. Not the best spot in the world since the cars are going fast around the corner and  don't have much time to stop. If your on this stretch make sure you start early so you can catch people heading to work. Bring lots of water and sun protection. June 2025.
Good spot lots of room to pull over was here in the late afternoon, low traffic got picked up eventually after a few hours. June 2025.
Bring lots of water and sun protection. You will be waiting for hours out in the sun with no protection other than with what you bring or clouds. June 2025.
Not the best spot in the world but it is what it is, make sure you start early in the morning so you can catch workers and travellers going west. July 2025.
On the highway, long straight stretch gives the  cars lots of time to see you. July 2025.
Decent room for cars to pull over. They are going fast but gotta make due with what you have. July 2025.
Not a bad spot. Somewhat decent room for cars to pull over that are coming from the on ramp but can't say the same for the ones already on the highway. July 2025.

I didn't actually hitch this spot. I was in a pitch so I booked a poparide instead. However, I walked past this spot and it's the perfect place for northbound rides. Visibility is perfect, open, plenty of space to pull over, and the vehicles won't be going too fast when they see you.
Not a lot of traffic, can stand on the on-ramp and highway. Got a ride to fredricton though, seems like most are going long distances
Waited about an hour. Not a lot of traffic. Might get lucky though
good spot to hitch a ride has lights so people are going by slow

Not great.
Was lucky to get a ride late in the evening, probably thanks to the street lights being there. 
Did not get very far though.
not alot of traffic coming through here, ended up getting lucky and being driven down to grandfalls for a more popular spot

Timmins is a not so great place to hitch out of, going east. No shoulders to stop anywhere. The ESSO Gas station is quite busy, more than the Shell opposite, so I was lucky to get a short lift to Matheson.

Got picked up here before I could even put my thumb out, which was lucky. Got a ride to Winnipeg.
Cars go partially slow after the Traffic Light and there is room to stop. Before that, I asked around at the nearby Esso and Shell Stations, but to no avail.

I was told lots of people on the way from Regina to Winnipeg stop here at the A&W for coffee, especially commuters in the morning.

Was too late for that, and I asked around at the Gas Station and got a ride east to Brandon there. Thumbing on the side of the road (Speed Limit 80, before the traffic light) didn't succeed.

I was standing on a different corner of this intersection until someone rolled down their window and suggested this spot because the truckers segue straight to the TCH. I did just that and after 1-2 hours a trucker slowed. It's a good spot because the traffic light has a short cycle so the queue gets backed up and cars can see you while waiting for the green light
Lots of traffic, but the wait time is surprisingly long, nobody wanted to stop. Shoulder is wide enough only if you go west. Beautiful view.
Not a lot of traffic. Wide shoulder. Right after traffic lights cars are slow which is good. Got a short ride to the closest overpass.

On paper this spot kind of sucks. It's kind of a suicide lane, but I for some reason I have good luck here.

Most of the traffic that you'll see here are pulling off to go to bridle falls waterpark. 

That said, try not to get dropped off here. If you get stuck there are some convenience stores, about a 10 min walk away.

5/5 durant le festif de baie St-Paul 
Il y a un bon trafic en général
Not the best location to do the hitchhiking , need to go further up to the hwy 212 according to the person who picked me up

Hitching south out of Sicamous is hard. I was very fortunate as a solo female traveler to have someone pick me up. This spot has decent through-traffic, slow speed and room to pull over. Only trouble is nobody in Sicamous wants to pick you up :-) Wait time was a while. Stay here for easy access to food/plugs/water at the restaurants up the road if you can't get a ride.

Take the 108 bus to the soccer field nearby, walk to the back of the soccer field and hop the fence/gate. Highway shoulder was closed for construction when I went, so getting a ride was difficult. Decent room to pull over otherwise. Lots of on-ramps leading here, so drivers aren't quite at highway speeds yet. Went EBD to Sicamous with a truck driver.
Quiet time of the day on the 16. 2 people pulled over as well but would've only taken me down the road but I decided to stay by the gas station and didn't wait too long after the first 2.

Gave it a 3star as it was raining all night and there's just enough of an eave for me to nap where it's dry. Sign was for thunder bay and Winnipeg, I said it's good.. it's the route I want anyway. Unexpected as I was just eating when the guy pulled in front of me.
Westbound ramp coming from the south. Waited forever on the opposite side. Guy saw my sign, stopped and said I'm actually going to north bay
Took a while to get a ride, but it was early in the morning. Got to Salmo
Got picked up by a guy in a camper bus who took me all the way to BC

We wait here 4 hours... Maybe bad luck because the spot was good with a gas station and the 2 roads for the east (the 11 for the North and the 17 for the south). More people are going throu the north. Nipigon is a good place to sleep (free campground in the marina).

Hitching east out of Creston sucks. 99% of the traffic you'll see is local. This spot isn't great but it's kind of your best option.
There is a set of lights to slow traffic down, and a parking lot for cars to pull off the road. Local traffic usually turns off at this intersection.

Getting here was damn painful - loads of construction on/around the on ramps people typically use to hitch out. Otherwise decent spot - lots of room to stop and lots of through traffic, esp. on weekends in the summer (people going to Banff).
I don't remember the exact spot, It was at gaz station for sure. Cars are going fast at the exit of La Baie St Paul be careful
Good spot to leave Québec toward Charlevoix. There is a "stop" where you really have the time to make eye contact with the driver !
Traffic is low and lots of local traffic, but there is space and the ride will come eventually.

Traffic light. Limited space for stopping, but doable at red light. Lots of local traffic, might be good to get a ride to Redcliff for a better spot. Sign is very useful, TC motel has a cardboard dumpster if needed
Tons of space, low speed after the stop sign, but low traffic.
Ok spot, space for trucks to stop but you might wait a bit before someone stops
Not a specific spot, just walking along the road
This spot is kind of in the middle of nowhere, but I've had good luck here.

I hitchhiked with that guy several times down the road until we both got to Vancouver, we kept splitting up and then getting dropped off in the same place as each other! I seen him in the middle of downtown Vancouver by chance on the last day of my stay there. Small world!
Japanese hitch-hiker stood here for several hours going from the junction to Golden. Not relatively safe to slow-down/pull-over for hitch-hikers.
